abstract: Cast and crew of Sesame Street are settling into revamped set as well as new home on HBO after 45 years on PBS; new season will feature number of changes in effort to appeal to current generation of children, including shorter episodes, modern sets and new theme song.
lead_paragraph: Oscar the Grouch has a recycling bin and Big Bird has moved to a tree as the children’s classic debuts on HBO, aiming at a generation that doesn’t distinguish between TV and mobile screens.

headline.main: ‘Sesame Street’ Gets New Upscale Look for HBO Premiere

snippet: Oscar the Grouch has a recycling bin and Big Bird has moved to a tree as the children’s classic debuts on HBO, aiming at a generation that doesn’t distinguish between TV and mobile screens.
